Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk selinux-policy
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: selinux-policy bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description:
Updated selinux-policy packages that fix several bugs are now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. The selinux-policy packages contain the rules that govern how confined processes run on the system.
This update fixes the following bugs:
* In Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.3, SELinux denied communication between the Puppet configuration tool and the D-Bus interface when using the timedatectl command. The selinux-policy packages have been updated, and Puppet can now run timedatectl. (BZ#1400505)
* Prior to this update, SELinux policy was rebuilt during online update. Consequently, updating the selinux-policy-targeted package using Yum failed with a traceback. The selinux-policy migration script has been fixed, and the selinux-policy update now works properly. (BZ#1401518)
* Previously, a rule for the Clustered Trivial Database (CTDB) was missing. As a consequence, SELinux denied successful finish of a CTDB failover. The transition rule for the "ctbd_t" domain was added, and a CTDB failover now succeeds. (BZ#1403266)
* Due to a missing SELinux rule, when two nodes of a Red Hat Gluster Storage (RHGS) server were restarted, the Pacemaker tool stopped services on all nodes. The rule for the "glusterd_t" domain has been added, and SELinux denials no longer occur during an RHGS server restart. (BZ#1408125)
* Due to missing policy rules, SELinux denied running systemd in a container. The rules to allow containers to write to "unix_sysctls" and to use file descriptors leaked to them from parent processes were added, and the SELinux denials no longer occur. (BZ#1408126)
* A missing SELinux rule was previously causing errors when adding a webhook using the gluster-eventsapi command. The rule to allow "glusterd_t" domain binds on glusterd UDP port has been added, and adding a webhook using gluster-eventsapi now works properly. (BZ#1408128)
Users of selinux-policy are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
